description: From Latin alvearium (“beehive”). In the sense of the hollow of the ear, because it is where the wax accumulates. In the sense of a repository: originally the name of a dictionary encompassing several languages, because of the many contributors being like "busy bees".

entries.meaning: A beehive, or anything resembling a beehive.
(anatomy) The hollow of the external ear.
A repository, especially of knowledge or information.
